hanzi-su-wiki:
庁

Значения

Государственное учреждение; департамент

Мнемоника

Сокращение. Навес 广 или здание, охраняемое солдатами 丁, где производится слушание дел.

Варианты

廳, 厅, 廰
purpleculture_pinyin:
tīng
Japanese variant of 厅
Японский вариант зала
rtega_mnemonic:
廳廳RS
厅厅		廰𥑈庁hall, central room
  • broad place 广 where people are listened 聽 to
  • ⓢ broad place 广 for receiving people 丁
heisig_constituent: government office, cave, street, nail, spike
koohiiStory1: Some bureaucrats at a government office decided that the tunnels of caves need to get street signs, which are then nailed to the walls of the cave.
koohiiStory2: In some of the scarier countries, when someone is invited to visit a "government office", it´s actually a dungeon where they´re dragged into a cave and nailed to the wall.
jp_example_words:
庁(ちょう): government office
官庁(かんちょう): government office, authorities
県庁(けんちょう): prefectural office
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: There are people under a canopy on the street forming their own agency. They're banding together right here in the street, making a new government office!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine them putting together papers, talking to politicians, and standing in the street outside the capitol. They demand for this agency to be formed. They are doing all the correct, legal things to do it too.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic:
This new agency is just starting to make progress when you hear a low rumble... then a screech.
"THIS IS MY STREET. NO NEW AGENCIES ON MY STREET!" Mrs. Chou (ちょう) cries as she barrels into everyone.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: "Whenever you're in a 丁, you're in my territory," she yells, taking out a few agency members with her fists. "You won't be starting any kind of agency here, not on my watch." And she lights it all on fire.
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), 亅 (зазубрина), 广 (скала с точкой)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the block (丁) under the stony cliff (广) is a government office

庁字的基本解释

庁
tīng
平。
古同“??”。

庁字的汉语字典释义

[①]［tīng］
［《廣韻》他丁切，平青，透。］
(1)平。
(2)疾病创痛。
(3)因病斜靠。
(4)同“廳”。《宋元以来俗字谱》：“廳”，《古今杂剧》、《三国志平话》作“庁”。

庁字的康熙字典解释

【寅集下】【广字部】　庁； 康熙笔画：5； 页码：页343第07
【廣韻】他丁切，音汀。【玉篇】平也。　又與?通。【集韻】?，省作庁。

庁字的源字形

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［tīng］
["Guang Yun" He Ding cut, flat green, through. ]
(1) Flat.
(2) Disease wounds and pain.
(3) Leaning due to illness.
(4) Same as "hall". "Song and Yuan Dynasties": "Ting", "Ancient and Modern Zaju", "Three Kingdoms Zhiping Hua" as "庁".
庁

[Yin Ji 2] [Guang Zi Department] 　庁; Kangxi strokes: 5; Page number: Page 343 No. 07
[Guang Yun] Tatin cut, Yin Ting. [Jade articles] Ping also.　Connect with? [Ji Yun]?, province Zuo.

Radicals: 广, 丁  (canopy, street)
Meaning Mnemonic
There are people under a canopy on the street forming their own agency. They're banding together right here in the street, making a new government office!
Imagine them putting together papers, talking to politicians, and standing in the street outside the capitol. They demand for this agency to be formed. They are doing all the correct, legal things to do it too.
Reading Mnemonic
This new agency is just starting to make progress when you hear a low rumble... then a screech.
"THIS IS MY STREET. NO NEW AGENCIES ON MY STREET!" Mrs. Chou (ちょう) cries as she barrels into everyone.
"Whenever you're in a 丁, you're in my territory," she yells, taking out a few agency members with her fists. "You won't be starting any kind of agency here, not on my watch." And she lights it all on fire.
